Posts.Content: I'm taking many mediccations, one thing was for the first 5 years after i did not know to get my thyroid checked and i wonder if that had anything to do with my hair not growing back after chemo therapy. I also had olvarian failure and lack of estrogen for the first 2 years afterwards and anytime i got a new docotor my therapy option for my estrogen was changed. I take thyroid medicines, estrogen medicine, and now GERD medicine. and still have this huge issue of my hair not growing back in fully.
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: Yes it has now been about 10 years and I take medicine for my estrogen since I can not produce it on my own. I still have the same thin hair with no layers. Whith the options you listed what should I go about trying? Ty
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: I would get your thyroid checked... come to find out I had hypo/hyperthyroidism and that in itself causes hair loss or hair to not grow back. Chemo damaged my thyroid glan and I wish I had caught it sooner.
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: I am too having a hypothroid problem, and ovalrian faiure where we can only find one undersized olvary and the other we can't and to top it off it doesn't even work. I have to take birthcontrol to have puberty after chemo therapy and to have my period and absorb calcium ect. I never had all my hair fall out so I did not shave my head, we wonder if that was the cause of it not going back fully... It is thin and not all of my head where my hair use to grow, grew back. I am told to take certian vaitamins that improve hair, nail and skin growth because I can't even have strong nails and my skin is sensative. sadlly hair every where else is growing fine but my head and part of my eye brows. I am finding out hair transplants are scams and that naioxine does not work unless you use it every day for the rest of your life and if you stop it goes back to how it was or worse... also I can't use cheap every day shampoos ect. I can't even use sented lotions, all of them have to be nonsented and the exspentive brands too. It is completely upsetting. I am trying to research how to make my hair grown to a better quality I am to start also taking vaitamins daily to improve on my lack of nutriance due to chemo. I am 8 years cancer free, but still my hair lacks and is high maitnance, hats have caused more thinning and I can not wear a wig all time due to brakeage of hair. I hope to keep in contact with others to figuring out a solution to this permanent problem.
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: Yes it has now been about 10 years and I take medicine for my estrogen since I can not produce it on my own. I still have the same thin hair with no layers. Whith the options you listed what should I go about trying? Ty
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: I'm taking many mediccations, one thing was for the first 5 years after i did not know to get my thyroid checked and i wonder if that had anything to do with my hair not growing back after chemo therapy. I also had olvarian failure and lack of estrogen for the first 2 years afterwards and anytime i got a new docotor my therapy option for my estrogen was changed. I take thyroid medicines, estrogen medicine, and now GERD medicine. and still have this huge issue of my hair not growing back in fully.
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: I have hypothroidism and ovarian failure and have taken many estrogen pills and now on one for people who have menopause (though I do not have that, I just can't produce estrogen on my own since my olvarian failure I got after chemo therapy). I am also now having GERD but I still have the same hair loss issue of my hair now growing back fully even with not taking any arimadex or tamoxifen... since I had lukiemia. Seems chemo can really leave a mess behind. I hope to find an answer soon, other than putting natrual hair oils or massaging the scalp or not wearing hats or wigs 24'7 due to it damaging the hair, or not over exposure to the sun. These things are important but I'm not seeing it being fixed yet.
Posts.Title: 2 years after chemo, my hair has not grown back

Posts.Content: Ty for the message, I am going on 12 years cancer free and I suffered with childhood lukiemia but it damaged many things to live, and being alive is a gift in itself but I don't think I can give up on wanting my hair growth back. Thank you for understanding.

Note I never had grapherers host desiese or any sort of rejection, I also had a 6 out of 6 match for my bmtp I had mds (a pre cancer curser before full blone lukimia). If anyone has any info to share may it be similar symtoms helath problems ect I would love to talk! Let us work together and press on to concure our insiqurities.
Posts.Title: 8 years after chemo therapy
